page.title: 19THE CLIMATE OF ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: Featured so often in the weather reports as the coldest or wettest place in Britain .The climate would appear to be unusually undesirable but fortunately there are long hours of sunshine. In 1908 a meteorological station was set up at an elevation of 800ft . Records of all aspects of the weather are compiled here.The average rainfall is between 55 and 60 inches. Snowfalls can be expected most winters.Severe and gale force winds have been been recorded in every month of the year. Heavy rainfall results in the flooding of fields as the tributaries of the Esk rush down and swell the rising river. Flockmasters remove sheep and cattle to higher ground. Snow brings hazards , icy roads and snow bound homesteads, but main roads are kept open by local snow ploughs.
